title: Instagram influencer accused of taking 'barely there bikini' trend too far
text:
Get the biggest daily news stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

"Wait, where is the swimsuit?"

That's the question a model was bombarded with after she revealed her new two-piece swimwear on Instagram .

At first glance Australian influencer Tammy Hembrow looks as naked as the day she was born.

But at much closer inspection, and we mean much closer, you can see her barely-there bikini.

It took a while for many of her 10 million followers to spot it though.

The mum-of-two, who is a fitness trainer from the Gold Coast, posted the pics saying: "For the sun lovers. The Minimale Animale splendor suit in my new colour ‘Euphoria’ dropping next week."

But it seems the only thing that was dropping was her followers' jaws.

One asked: "Wait, where’s the swimsuit?”

Another wrote: “You left nothing to the imagination here."

“What’s the point of wearing anything?” another follower asked.

Another exclaimed: “Christ, that’s just string.”

While a shocked follower screamed: "OH MY GOD"

Since she upload the image on Tuesday morning the post has had more than 370,000 likes.

(Image: minimale-animale)

Tammy's bikini is the latest take on the "naked" swimwear trend.

The $190 (£150) bikini has a few small patches to protect the wearer’s bits and pieces – you just can’t see them from the side.

Tammy isn't shy when it comes top wearing 'naked' swimwear as previous photos on her Instagram have had follower gasping but this latest post "oversteps the line" according to one of her followers.

In July, she wore a design with see-through straps that was classed as "vulgar' by some followers.
description: Australian mum Tammy Hembrow's latest swimwear pic has almost crashed the internet
